title: Deadline
body_text:
LA’s Micheaux Film Festival Locks 2024 Edition With Projects Featuring Viola Davis, Michael Ealy, Morris Chestnut & Michael Gandolfini
EXCLUSIVE: LA’s Micheaux Film Festival will officially run at The Culver Theater in Culver City from October 21 to October 27 with a selection of short and feature projects with talent such as Viola Davis and Morris Chestnut. Scroll down to see the featured lineup.
The festival, launched by Courtney L. Branch and Noel Braham to honor the legendary Oscar Micheaux, celebrates its sixth anniversary this year. The festival’s theme will be Champions, a celebration of “the resilience and determination of filmmakers who overcome countless obstacles to bring their visions to life.”
This year’s lineup includes more than 250 short films, feature films, and new media series with additional projects screening virtually. Titles include The Ebony Canal, a 46-minute feature on Black infant mortality rates narrated by Viola Davis. Also screening is The Origin, a project produced by Morris Chestnut, and Tea, a short project from filmmaker Blake Winston Rice featuring Michael Gandolfini. Alongside screenings, the festival will also host an industry-focused forum with panels featuring execs, agents, and managers. The festival has said it expects over 4,500+ guests.
“We are honored to celebrate the enduring legacy of Oscar Micheaux, and illuminate the path for contemporary international filmmakers who mirror his pioneering spirit,” founders Noel Braham and Courtney Branch told us this morning. “This year’s festival is poised to be a catalyst for inspiration and an indelible milestone.”
2024 Micheaux Film Festival Lineup:
Desde La Raiz
(Dir./Prod: Paulina Gamiz, Gus Sánchez; EPs: Ray Jimenez, Jaime Camil)
Notable Talent: Jaime Camil (Jane the Virgin)
Logline: In this four part docu-series, actor Jaime Camil (Jane the Virgin) will explore origins and meaning of Mexican products like coffee, chile, corn, and mezcal. Camil describes the series as “a love letter to México and some of the country’s richest heritage and legendary commodities.”
Docuseries | Runtime: 42:00
The Distinguished
(Dir.: Rickey Castleberry, Writer: Rickey Castleberry, Rodney Wilkins, Producer: Zach Fuqua, Rickey Castleberry, Khaild Jordan)
Notable Talent: Harold Perrineau, Tracie Thoms, Luke Youngblood, Tosin Morohunfola, Jonathan Burke, Shawn Carter Peterson
Logline: A young boy’s reality transforms as he deciphers cryptic messages from a supernatural force in his dreams, uncovering his family’s legacy.
Short Film | Runtime:16:24
Premiere Status: World Premiere
Meal Ticket
(Dir.: Wes Andre Goodrich, Writers: Wes Andre Goodrich, Patrick Nichols, Producers: Hillman Grad, 271, Patrick Nichols)
Notable Talent: Siddiq Saunderson, Wu-Tang: An American Saga // Coy Stewart, Are We There Yet? // Grace Duah, Gossip Girl
Logline: An anxiety thriller about a manager: Saint, who is forced to decide what to do with life-changing news he receives about his client: a young hip hop star, twelve minutes before goes onstage for his debut tour.
Short Film | Runtime: 12:43
All In
(Dir./Prod: Dusan Brown; Producers: Yuchuan Cao, Joyce Kelly-Brown
James Kexian Lee)
Notable Talent: Dusan Brown, Netflix’s Ma Rainey’s Black Bottom, Legendary’s 42
Logline: When an enterprising teen is left with seemingly insurmountable debt by his unscrupulous, late father, he must play poker to either make the money back and save what’s left of his family… or die trying.
Student Short Film | Runtime: 14:51
Premiere Status: World Premiere
Ray of Hope
(Dir/Writers: Ryan Singh, Nikila Cole, Producers: Ryan Singh, Patricia Scarlett, Nikila Cole)
Notable Talent: Rathika Sitsabaiesan, Former Canadian Member of Parliament
Logline: Ray of Hope is a personal journey of an Eelam Tamil Canadian woman who survived the Sri Lankan armed conflict, advocating for others with interspersed stories of healing and triumphs.
Feature Film | Runtime: 1:30:00

(Dir/ Writer: Julie Sharbutt, Producer: Whitney Wolanin)
Notable Talent: Julie Sharbutt (I’m Dying Up Here, The Good Wife, 3 Days, Moved, The Weekend)
Logline: When a phone scammer makes one last late night call, the woman on the other end gives her much more than she bargained for.

(Dir.: Parker Croft, Writers: Aaron Golden, Parker Croft, Producers: Max Loeb, Parker Croft, Aaron Golden, Chris Blim, Laura Coover
Notable Talent: EP Abigail Breslin, EP Jon Michael Hill, Associate Producer Nolan Gould

Two Breaths
(Dir.: Kateryna Kurganska, Writers: Kateryna Kateryna, Myka Arakawa, Timur Guseynov, Producers: Kateryna Kateryna, Don John, C Craig Patterson, Timur Guseynov, Valerie Delahaye, Nick Brooks)

Logline: After a man-made disaster decimates an evergreen island, a stranded 11-year-old girl must find the tenacity to leave behind her home with the help of an unlikely friend.

Word of Oda
(Dir/Writer: Nesha Jackson, Producer: Nesha Jackson, NEEN.)
Notable Talent: NEEN – Executive Producer
Logline: A member of Club Oda – an underground cult of One Piece extremists – kidnaps and rehabilitates his girlfriend after date night, doesn’t go as planned.

Marque Dos
(Dir/Writer:Asha Chai-Chang)
Notable Talent: Isaac Gonzalez Rossi – Lead in Netflix’s Global Top Ten film “That’s Amor”; Netflix/ starring Jennifer Lopez “The Mother”; Just booked Paramount+ “Dexter: Original Sin”; seen in HBO’s “Westworld,” “NCIS”, Amazon’s “As We See It,” and NBC’s “I Feel Bad.”| Roxy Rivera – “The Idea of You” (Prime/ stars Anne Hathaway) ; Hit Man, Dynasty, HBO’s “The RIghteous Gemstones”, and national commercials. Adargiza De Los Santos – “Grey’s Anatomy”, “The Horror of Dolores Roach” , “Abbott Elementary”, “This is Us” , and “Criminal Minds”
Logline:An aspiring tour manager moves up the ranks in the marketing industry where discovering herself and her place in the world faces off with the demands of her dream job.

Tricked and Treated

My Brother & Me
(Dir/Writer: Ryan DeForeest, Producers: Ryan DeForeest, Shandrea Evans, Lexx Truss)
Notable Talent: Alexander Bello: Theater Camp (Searchlight), And Just Like That (HBO), John Mulaney & the Sack Lunch Bunch (Netflix) — Rodney Hobbs: Shirley (Netflix), Young Dylan (Nickelodeon),

Julian

Logline:Suat goes to a cafe in an area he doesn’t know about before and sits down to wait for his friend. He is unaware that this cafe is actually located under the mosque and was set up in the area where the funeral ceremony is being held. At that moment, a funeral comes to the cafe and interesting images emerge. Suat and the other customers cannot hide their surprise at this situation and it is revealed once again how ordinary death is in life.
Int’l Short Film | Runtime: 0:08:30

Groupies

(Dir/Writer/Producer: Evan Cleaver)

Notable Talent: Matt McCoy – Seinfeld, Police Academy, Silicon Valley, Jack Ryan

Who in the Hell is Regina Jones?
(Dir.: Soraya Selene, Writer: Billy Miossi, Producers: Alissa Shapiro, Sam Pollard)
Notable Talent: Sam Pollard
Logline: The extraordinary life of Regina Jones is one not only shaped by history, but also one that made history. From being pregnant and married at 15, through the middle of the Watts Rebellion of 1965, to emerging as a groundbreaking newspaper publisher, Regina is a testament to the American experience.
Feature Film | Runtime: 1:42:00
Premiere Status: LA Premiere
BACKLOG
(Dir/Writer: Jacqueline Elyse Rosenthal, Producers: Robin Wang, Marian Cook, Josh Powell
Notable Talent: Jill Renner (Lead)

Short Film | Runtime: 0:12:51
Premiere Status: LA Premiere
RESPECT MY CROWN: THE RISE OF AFRICAN AMERICAN WOMEN IN CALIFORNIA POLITICS
(Dir.: Pamela Bright-Moon, Writers:Jocelyn Y. Stewart, Alisa Bass Covington, Pamela Bright-Moon, Producers: Alisa Bass-Covington, Pamela Bright-Moon)
Notable Talent: Julianne Malveaux, Ph.D.; Karen R. Bass; Barbara Lee; Sydney Kamlager-Dove; Shirley Weber, Ph.D.; Lola Smallwood Cuevas; Tina McKinnor; Mia Bonta; Lori Wilson; Holly J. Mitchell; Areva Martin; Emma Sharif, Racquel Vasquez, Deborah Robertson, Acquanetta Warren, Tasha Cerda, Yvonne Wheeler, Kellie Todd Griffin, Charisse Bremond Weaver, Jan Perry, Laura Richardson, Heather Hutt, Jackie Lacey. Not interviewed but featured: Vice President Kamala Harris, US Congresswoman Maxine Waters.
Logline: In the state of California, Black women have battled race and gender barriers in pursuit of equality and political power, for the past 170 years. Respect My Crown: The Rise of African American Women in California Politics, reveals the sacrifices and contributions these women made to become leading voices in politics, community activism, organized labor and the judicial system.
Feature Film | Runtime: 1:26:00
Blindspot
(Dir/Writer: Luke O’Sullivan, Producers: Luke O’Sullivan, Mallory Jansen, Thomas Simon)
Notable Talent: Mallory Jansen, actress in AGENTS OF S.H.I.E.L.D, THE BIG LEAP, GALAVANT, THIS IS US, YOUNG & HUNGRY
Logline: BLINDSPOT takes place over the course of one night, as a woman deals with the aftermath of a fatal car accident that blurs the lines between right and wrong. The film follows June as she is taken to the police station for questioning, while the police struggle to distinguish between victim and perpetrator.
Short Film | Runtime: 0:11:30
Reunion
(Dir/Writer: Timothy S Naylor, Zainab Jah, Producers: Djaka Souaré, Timothy S Naylor, Zainab Jah)
Notable Talent: Executive Producer: Danai Gurira. Associate Producer: Lupita Nyong’o
Logline: REUNION – a West African immigrant living the Bronx, discovers the child soldier who destroyed her family, years later, is now a best selling author living in New York City. Combining live action with graphic novel techniques and with Danai Gurira as Executive Producer, this award winning short has qualified for the 2025 Oscars.
Short Film | Runtime: 0:15:30
Huli
(Dir/Writer: Daniel Croix, Producers: Max Mooney, Phil Schlieder, William Rouse, Richard Hamasaki, Mele Hamasaki, Emily May Jampel)
Notable Talent: Daniel Croix (Manhunt on Apple TV+, The Oval on BET, Love Victor on Hulu)
Logline: After a boxer flees from New York to Hawaiʻi, a friendship with his coach expands his awareness of identity, purpose, and power.
Short Film | Runtime: 0:12:00
Premiere Status: LA Premiere
MORROW
(Dirs.: Rich Monteiro, Lexx Truss, Producers: Gregory Warfield, Victoria Griggs)
Notable Talent: Rich Morrow (John Henry, Young Rock, Mindhunter, Hacks, Swoon)
Logline: From the spotlight on the court as a D-1 basketball player to the spotlight on set as a rising thespian, we follow Rich Morrow’s journey from one exhilarating road to the next.
Short Film | Runtime: 0:22:00
Premiere Status: World/LA Premiere
The Newlyweds: Blood at The Altar
(Dir/Writer: Lucien Christian Adderley, Richard “Byrd” Wilson, Producers: Moon Lee Ferguson, Kiara Diana, Tanisha Cidel, LaToya Tonodeo, Arlen Escarpeta, Analisa Velez)
Notable Talent:Latoya Tonodeo ( Power Book II: Ghost (STARZ), The Fosters, The Oath, The Perfect Match), Arlen Escarpeta (Found (NBC), Whitney, David Makes Man, Final Destination 5, Friday the 13th, S.W.A.T, NCIS), Alex Hibbert (Moonlight, The Chi, Black Panther), Analisa Velez (The Game, Quantum Leap, Almost Love), Bertrand E Boyd II (Queen & Slim, P-Valley, Cherish The Day)
Logline: On the day of their wedding, a newlywed couple must battle everyone they love in order for their marriage to survive.
Short Film | Runtime: 0:14:42
Premiere Status: World Premiere
N.ot W.ithout A.lonzo: The Origins of West Coast Hip Hop (2024)
(Dir/Writer/Producer: Timothy Lee Conley
Notable Talent: Grandmaster Lonzo: Godfather of West Coast Hip Hop – World Class Wreckin’ Cru, The D.O.C.: Hip-Hop Pioneer, DJ Yella: Rock N Roll Hall of Fame – NWA/World Class Wreckin’ Cru, Kurtis Blow: Hip Hop Pioneer, MC JB: Hip Hop Pioneer – JJ Fad, Arabian Prince: Rock N Roll Hall of Fame – NWA/Uncle Jamm’s Army, DJ Cli-N-Tel: Hip Hop PioneerWorld Class Wreckin’ Cru, DJ Battlecat: Hip Hop Pioneer, The Poetess: Hip Hop Pioneer – Los Angeles Radio Host (92.3 The Beat FM 1990s)
Logline: N.ot W.ithout A.lonzo: Every success has an origin story. Grandmaster Lonzo, The Godfather of West Coast Hip-Hop narrates and details the origin story of West Coast Hip Hop from 1974-1987.

Expanding Sanctuary
Dir/Writer: Kristal Sotomayor
Notable Talent: Music by Las Cafeteras
Logline: An immigrant mother emerges as a community leader during the historic campaign to end the sharing of the Philadelphia police database with Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE). Expanding Sanctuary tells a rarely told story about a Latinx immigrant community’s successful journey to change legislation and protect families.
Short Film | Runtime: 0:20:00
Premiere Status: LA Premiere
HARLEM FRAGMENTS
(Dir.: Cameron Tyler Carr, Writers: Cameron Tyler Carr, Wes Andre Goodrich, Danielle Therese Dougé, Producers: Flor Tejada, Collin Meath, Ben Thompson, Salma Qarnain)
Notable Talent: Roderick Lawrence – Silent Partner, Tina The Musical, Lion King
Logline: Harlem Fragments is an Afro-futurist scrapbook storytelling of a Harlem Black family’s beautiful destruction during the 2008 recession. A natural disaster so mesmerizing you can’t look away from the tragedy. Based on true events.
Short Film | Runtime: 0:17:00

Logline: The film is seen through the eyes of Grace, age 6. The world as she sees it, innocent and carefree. Grace is Black. 1977, London. The political climate is volatile with the rise of the National Front calling for the repatriation of immigrants and appealing to racial hatred. Grace plays in her garden. Bored, she opens the back gate seeking adventure. Along the New River path, she falls cutting her hand badly. Grace’s mother thinks she is playing in the back garden until the doorbell rings. She opens to see a skinhead boy wearing a Nazi t-shirt with Grace, her blood on his hands. Micro aggressions culminate in a moment at their white Christian Church. Grace reaches out her hand to the white woman next to her, the woman recoils. At this moment, we see little Grace for the first time, a tiny piece of her heart breaks.
